def create_snapshot(self) -> GameSnapshot: 
188    def create_snapshot(self) -> GameSnapshot:
189        """Create an immutable snapshot of the current game state.
190        
191        Returns:
192            A GameSnapshot containing a deep copy of the current state.
193        """
194        # Create deep copies of mutable objects
195        players_copy = [copy.deepcopy(player) for player in self.players]
196        community_cards_copy = copy.deepcopy(self.community_cards)
197        events_copy = copy.deepcopy(self.events)
198        
199        return GameSnapshot(
200            phase=self.phase,
201            community_cards=community_cards_copy,
202            pot=self.pot,
203            current_bet=self.current_bet,
204            last_raiser=self.last_raiser,
205            last_raise_amount=self.last_raise_amount,
206            players=players_copy,
207            dealer_position=self.dealer_position,
208            current_player=self.current_player,
209            small_blind=self.small_blind,
210            big_blind=self.big_blind,
211            street_index=self.street_index,
212            events=events_copy
213        )

class GameSnapshot: 
 18@dataclass
 19class GameSnapshot:
 20    """
 21    Immutable snapshot of game state for external consumption.
 22    
 23    This class provides a read-only view of the game state that can be
 24    safely shared with UI components, AI players, and other external systems.
 25    """
 26    
 27    # Game phase and cards
 28    phase: Phase
 29    community_cards: List[Card]
 30    
 31    # Pot and betting information
 32    pot: int
 33    current_bet: int
 34    last_raiser: Optional[int]
 35    last_raise_amount: int
 36    
 37    # Player and position information
 38    players: List[Player]  # These are copies, not references
 39    dealer_position: int
 40    current_player: Optional[int]
 41    
 42    # Game configuration
 43    small_blind: int
 44    big_blind: int
 45    
 46    # Round tracking
 47    street_index: int
 48    
 49    # Event log
 50    events: List[str]
 51    
 52    def get_active_players(self) -> List[Player]:
 53        """Get all players who can currently act.
 54        
 55        Returns:
 56            List of players with ACTIVE status.
 57        """
 58        return [p for p in self.players if p.status == SeatStatus.ACTIVE]
 59    
 60    def get_players_in_hand(self) -> List[Player]:
 61        """Get all players still in the current hand.
 62        
 63        Returns:
 64            List of players with ACTIVE or ALL_IN status.
 65        """
 66        return [p for p in self.players if p.status in [SeatStatus.ACTIVE, SeatStatus.ALL_IN]]
 67    
 68    def get_player_by_seat(self, seat_id: int) -> Optional[Player]:
 69        """Get player by seat number.
 70        
 71        Args:
 72            seat_id: The seat number to look up.
 73            
 74        Returns:
 75            The player at the specified seat, or None if not found.
 76        """
 77        for player in self.players:
 78            if player.seat_id == seat_id:
 79                return player
 80        return None
 81    
 82    def get_current_player(self) -> Optional[Player]:
 83        """Get the player whose turn it is to act.
 84        
 85        Returns:
 86            The current player, or None if no current player.
 87        """
 88        if self.current_player is None:
 89            return None
 90        return self.get_player_by_seat(self.current_player)
 91    
 92    def to_dict(self, viewer_seat: Optional[int] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 93        """Convert snapshot to dictionary format.
 94        
 95        Args:
 96            viewer_seat: Seat number of the viewer, used to hide other players' cards.
 97            
 98        Returns:
 99            Dictionary representation of the game state.
100        """
101        players_data = []
102        for player in self.players:
103            # Hide cards from other players
104            hide_cards = viewer_seat is not None and player.seat_id != viewer_seat
105            
106            player_data = {
107                'seat_id': player.seat_id,
108                'name': player.name,
109                'chips': player.chips,
110                'current_bet': player.current_bet,
111                'status': player.status.name,
112                'hole_cards': player.get_hole_cards_str(hidden=hide_cards),
113                'is_dealer': player.is_dealer,
114                'is_small_blind': player.is_small_blind,
115                'is_big_blind': player.is_big_blind
116            }
117            players_data.append(player_data)
118        
119        return {
120            'phase': self.phase.name,
121            'community_cards': [str(card) for card in self.community_cards],
122            'pot': self.pot,
123            'current_bet': self.current_bet,
124            'current_player': self.current_player,
125            'dealer_position': self.dealer_position,
126            'players': players_data,
127            'small_blind': self.small_blind,
128            'big_blind': self.big_blind,
129            'street_index': self.street_index,
130            'last_raiser': self.last_raiser,
131            'last_raise_amount': self.last_raise_amount
132        }

Immutable snapshot of game state for external consumption.

This class provides a read-only view of the game state that can be safely shared with UI components, AI players, and other external systems.

def get_player_by_seat(self, seat_id: int) -> Optional[Player]: 
68    def get_player_by_seat(self, seat_id: int) -> Optional[Player]:
69        """Get player by seat number.
70        
71        Args:
72            seat_id: The seat number to look up.
73            
74        Returns:
75            The player at the specified seat, or None if not found.
76        """
77        for player in self.players:
78            if player.seat_id == seat_id:
79                return player
80        return None

Get player by seat number.

def get_current_player(self) -> Optional[Player]: 
82    def get_current_player(self) -> Optional[Player]:
83        """Get the player whose turn it is to act.
84        
85        Returns:
86            The current player, or None if no current player.

def to_dict(self, viewer_seat: Optional[int] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
 92    def to_dict(self, viewer_seat: Optional[int] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 93        """Convert snapshot to dictionary format.
 94        
 95        Args:
 96            viewer_seat: Seat number of the viewer, used to hide other players' cards.
 97            
 98        Returns:
 99            Dictionary representation of the game state.
100        """
101        players_data = []
102        for player in self.players:
103            # Hide cards from other players
104            hide_cards = viewer_seat is not None and player.seat_id != viewer_seat
105            
106            player_data = {
107                'seat_id': player.seat_id,
108                'name': player.name,
109                'chips': player.chips,
110                'current_bet': player.current_bet,
111                'status': player.status.name,
112                'hole_cards': player.get_hole_cards_str(hidden=hide_cards),
113                'is_dealer': player.is_dealer,
114                'is_small_blind': player.is_small_blind,
115                'is_big_blind': player.is_big_blind
116            }
117            players_data.append(player_data)
118        
119        return {
120            'phase': self.phase.name,
121            'community_cards': [str(card) for card in self.community_cards],
122            'pot': self.pot,
123            'current_bet': self.current_bet,
124            'current_player': self.current_player,
125            'dealer_position': self.dealer_position,
126            'players': players_data,
127            'small_blind': self.small_blind,
128            'big_blind': self.big_blind,
129            'street_index': self.street_index,
130            'last_raiser': self.last_raiser,
131            'last_raise_amount': self.last_raise_amount
132        }

Convert snapshot to dictionary format.

Args: viewer_seat: Seat number of the viewer, used to hide other players' cards.

Returns: Dictionary representation of the game state.

def new_deck(shuffled: bool = True, rng=None) -> Deck: 
17def new_deck(shuffled: bool = True, rng=None) -> Deck:
18    """
19    Create a new deck of cards.
20    
21    Args:
22        shuffled: Whether to shuffle the deck after creation
23        rng: Random number generator for shuffling
24        
25    Returns:
26        Deck: A new deck of 52 cards
27    """
28    deck = Deck(rng=rng)
29    if shuffled:

31    return deck
